Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler ; TM 224; see also 1472, 5731
_description: Verses on the kings of England, from William the Conqueror to Henry VI — in couplets

BodAddE7.First Lines:
The mighty William Duk of Normandy By Iust tale and by his
                    CheualryAs olde Bokys to vs makyn mensiounMade kyng by conquest of
                    brutis of Albioun…
BodAddE7.Last Lines:
…Now lord him sende suche gouernaunceLong to reioise and Regne
                    in his Right
BodAddE7.Note:
A roll: 192 lines in couplets except last stanza, which uses alternate
                    rhyme (abab); names of the kings appear before each entry
BodAddE7.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 717-22.

BodAshRol21.First Lines:
At Westmyster William icrowned wasThe furst day day of
                    CristemasA gret thyng after he dude þanneMade the kyng of Skottys
                    his legeman…
BodAshRol21.Last Lines:
…And þe x ȝere by and byHe was crowned at
                        Westmyster Parise trywlyHe weddid þe kynges
                    douȝter of sisssile margretThe whuch wold to yngland neuer good ne
                    profet
BodAshRol21.Note:
A roll, number 25 in Black (1845)
XBlack,  William Henry. 
             Catalogi Codicum Manuscriptorum Bibliothecae Bodleianae…Pars X,
                A…Catalogue of the Manuscripts bequeathed…by Elias Ashmole.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1845; last two lines added,
                    and followed by further prose notes of the reign

Bod131.First Lines:
Þis myghtty William duke of NorthmandyÞat by iuste tytill
                    And also by chyualeryConquered this land And kyng bycomeAnd þe
                    kyng of Scotts he made his legeman…
Bod131.Last Lines:
…Now lord send hym siche gouernauncelong to reioyse &
                    reigne in his ryght
Bod131.Note:
194 lines; variant first three lines influenced by Lydgate’s
                    ‘Kings’ (5731)

BodDig186.First Lines:
At Westmynster William he crownnyd wasThe fyrste day of
                    CrystynmesA grete thynge after dyd he þanneMade þe
                        kynge of Scotland his hegmann…
BodDig186.Last Lines:
…Att Westmynster he had his beryingexxxvi ȝere he reigned
                    kynge
BodDig186.Note:
Alternating with 5731 up
                    to Edward I, scattered in a prose chronicle

BodDoug2.First Lines:
This myghty William duke of NormandyBy iuste titel and by
                    chyueleryConquerid englond and kynge bycomeAnd [ ] kynge of Scotts
                    made his legemon…
BodDoug2.Last Lines:
…Of vertues lyfe & chosen hym for his knyghtLonge to
                    reioyse in his right
BodDoug2.Note: A roll; borrowing lines from 5731 at beginning and end

BodRawC86.First Lines:
The myghte William Duke of Normandyhat be ryght tytle & be
                    chevalryConqueryd Inglond & was kyng euynand also the lond
                        g of scottes he wane certen…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…he raynyd kyng xxxviij ye & more& is buryed att
                    Wyndesore
BodRawC86.Note:
Variant beginning echoing 5731; King’s names as headings to each stanza;
                    followed by prose ‘Title of France’

BLCottJulDVIII.First Lines:
[ ]t Westminster Willyam I crovnyd wasThe first day of
                    Cristemas…
BLCottJulDVIII.Last Lines:
…And the x ȝere by and byAt Parysh he was crouned
                    tryly

BLCottJulEIV.First Lines:
The miȝti William duke of NormandyAs bokis old makith
                    mensionBi iuste titill & bi his chivalriWas king bi conquest of
                    brutes albion…
BLCottJulEIV.Last Lines:
…And the x yere by and byAt Parise he was crownid
                    truli

BLHar78.First Lines:
att Westmynster William Crownyd wasThe ffurst daye of
                    Cristemasse…
BLHar78.Last Lines:
…In the x yere by and byhe was Crownyn in parys
                    Trowly
BLHar78.Note:
Names of kings at head of each stanza, beginning, ‘William
                    Conquerowr’ f. 69v, and prose notes in margins

BLHar4205.First Lines: At westminster william I crowned wasthe first day of Cristymasse…
BLHar4205.Last Lines: …And the xe yere by and byAt Parys was crownyd trewly
BLHar4205.Note: 217 lines, with Full-page illustrations of each of the kings.s

BLSl1986.First Lines:
At Westmynster William i crownyd wasThe furst day then of
                    Crystemas…
BLSl1986.Last Lines:
…And in ȝe regne of the xix ȝere veramentþe
                    duke of york whas made of france regent
BLSl1986.Note: Additional eight lines at end on reign of Henry VI

Aylesford.First Lines:
…At westmynstre William y crowned was
                    The furst day of Crystynmasse
                    A grete thyng dyd he thanne
                    Made the kyng of Scottes hys legeman…
Aylesford.Last Lines:
…In hys regne the viij. ȝere
                    he was Crowned at westmynstre
                    And the x. ȝere by and by
                    At Parys he was Crowned truly
Aylesford.Note: Photocopies in Warwickshire, Warwickshire Record Office Z 155[L], and Coventry, Coventry Archives Acc. 351. At end, portrait of Edward IV but no stanza to describe his reign.

Hertfordroll.First Lines:
…[ ] king of s[ ]Also of [ ]y h[ ][ ]glond he [ ][
                    ] regned here [ ]Be [ ]nd [ ] see he [ ]…
Hertfordroll.Last Lines:
…And the x yere by and byAtt Paris he was crovnyd
                    truly
Hertfordroll.Note:
A roll; top damaged so that text illegible; first legible words from
                    usual line 4 of the text

CollArmsAr58.First Lines: At Westmynster William I Crovned was…
CollArmsAr58.Last Lines:
…And the x yere by and byAt Parys he was crouned
                    truly
CollArmsAr58.Note: Concluding interpolation in 1193; post-medieval transcription is Cambridge UK,  Magdalene College Pepys 2833, ff. 519-526
CollArmsAr58.Editions:
Hearne,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Robert of Gloucester’s Chronicle.
         Oxford: at the Theatre, 1724; repr. 1810: 585-95.

YaleBeiOsa14.First Lines:
This [ ] William Duk of NormandyThat by Iust tytell And Also by
                    chyualryConquered this lond And kynge bycomeAnd the kynge of scottes
                    made his lechman…
YaleBeiOsa14.Last Lines:
…And in ȝe regne of the xix ȝere verament…The
                    vi herry Brougth forth in vertuBy Iuste tytell born by
                    enherytanceAfore provyded by grace of criste IhesuTo were ii crounes
                    in Englond & ffraunseCrowned at Westmester þe viii ȝyer of
                    his reigneAnd in his x ȝyer a parys in substaunceRyally Resseyuyd
                    for lord and souereynAs rightfull kyng of Englond and ffraunseTo whom
                    oure lord hath gyff suffisaunceOf wertuous lyfe and chose hym for his
                    kneyteNow lord hym send such gouernauncelonge to reigne
                    reioyse and reigne in his reght
YaleBeiOsa14.Note:
Followed by note, ‘Phelop the kyng of ffraunse had Isew in sonnus
                    which iii sonnus deyd with oute Isew, And þen he had a douȝter
                    þat higte Isabell þe wich was Maryed to kyng Edward off Carnaruerne By
                    whom sche had Isew kyng Edward of Wyndesore and after the deth of þis iii
                    sonnus Phelyp þe son off Charlys of Valays was made kyng wich Charlys was
                    Broder to þe forseyd kyng Phelype fadur to Isabell and þus wrongfully
                    dysheryth þe seyd Edward of Wyndesore which was rigfull eyer to Eynglond
                    and ffraunse’ (end of roll); second word illegible due to
                    wear

NYPLSpenc193.First Lines:
At Westmynster William crowned wasþe first day of
                    Cristenmas……After hym reygned his sone full ryȝtHerry
                    þe v þat ȝonge knycht[ ] with good [ ]Was his vncle a[
                    ]nyst þe [ ]& iij þe [ ]…
NYPLSpenc193.Last Lines:
…After hym reygnd his sone full ryȝtþe vj Herry
                    þat noble knyght…
NYPLSpenc193.Note:
A roll; at end, text partly damaged by damp or wear, and partly lost
                    through loss of last vellum piece

TokyoTak35.First Lines:
Edwarde þe first renyde trwlyAnd sonne he was to kynge
                    herryHe conqueryde than all scottlandAnd tok Irelande in to his
                    hand…
TokyoTak35.Last Lines:
…And þe tente yere by and byAt parys he was crownyde
                    truly
TokyoTak35.Note:
Begins with Edward I; roll covers earlier kings, but only in Latin
                    prose; ends in reign of Henry VI.

TokyoTak52.First Lines:
[ ] by ȝonde þe [ ]In Normandy h[ ]d a hameAnd ys
                    buryid in þe toune of Came…
TokyoTak52.Last Lines:
…And in the x-th ȝere by and byAt parys he was cronyd
                    truly
TokyoTak52.Note:
Damaged at top of first membrane, so part of text at beginning is
                    lost.

StA38660.First Lines:
Att Westminster William i Crownyd was
                    The firste day of Crystynmas
                    A grett thynge aftur dyd he than
                    He made the kynge of scottis his ligeman
                    …
StA38660.Last Lines:
…He regnyd xxij yere & moore
                    And to langeley he was y boore
                    But in the .v. kynge harryes tyme
                    He was leyde at westmynstere by Anne the quene
StA38660.Note: Ends imperfectly after the stanza on Richard II, due to loss of third membrane, though portrait of Henry IV in its roundel survives at base of second membrane. Starts with large medallion with full-length portrait and text: “Willelmus Conquerour,” text beneath.

SomersetDDS.First Lines:
At Westmynstr William y crowned was
                    The forste daye of Cristynmas
                    A grett thyng aftur dyd he thanne
                    He made the kyng of scottes hys lyege man…
SomersetDDS.Last Lines:
…In hys regne the viij yere
                    he was crowned att Westmynstre
                    And the .x yere by and by
                    Att paryse he was crowned trewly
SomersetDDS.Note:
Alongside the final stanza is a 6-line extension to in a different hand and ink:
                    
                    At laste of his enemys þat were
                    I sleyne he was and suffred deth cruell
                    Almost xl wynter he raynyd here
                    he lay in cherssay many a yere
                    Aftyr transferred to windsesore with solace
                    Now euery man may know what he was
                    
                    But the main hand/ink continues directly below the Henry VI stanza with a prose note about Edward III’s claim to the throne of France.

Northallerton.First Lines:
…Thanne reyned Willilam the secunde sonne
                    A Full stueue lokeyng goome
                    he yawe the eldyr brothyr for his parte
                    Euery yere iij thowsande marke…
Northallerton.Last Lines:
…yn hys [   ]ne the viij yere
                    [ ]e was crowned at westemynster
                    [ ]nd in the x yer by and by
                     was crowned at paryse
                    … wyrshypfully
Northallerton.Note: Added to dorse of an account roll. First stanza missing so begins William Rufus, though it retains the portrait of William I in a roundel. Begins roundel and sketch of William I with space left for verse but text not supplied; text thus begins with William II stanza. The roll is damaged at the left side here, and the ME text is set right at the left so the starts of lines are lost, but it is clearly the Henry VI stanza.
